channel.title: CLOSE:Problem not fixed but noone can help

item.title: CLOSE:Problem not fixed but noone can help
item.dc:creator: @Oh-Noes Oh-Noes
item.description:
@Oh-Noes wrote:

Oh right, forgot - add:

c.refreshSkills();

to the case, that’ll make the exp changes visible. The exp is being added, but the interfaces don’t update unless you make them, which is what refreshSkills is for.

Read full topic
item.source: CLOSE:Problem not fixed but noone can help

item.title: CLOSE:Problem not fixed but noone can help
item.dc:creator: @demonlover14 demonlover14
item.description:
@demonlover14 wrote:

[quote=“Oh-Noes, post:26, topic:338198”]Okay the method for addSkillXP is:

public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill)

So, the first number in the brackets is how much exp you want to add. The second is the skill ID you want it to be added to - for example attack is 0, defence is 1, hp is 3, agility is 16 and so on. So 650000 would NOT fit there.

As for your error, that’s easy - exp isn’t an existing variable, so you can’t use it. I’d assume from your code that what you’re trying to use is:

playerXP[10]

Incase you didn’t follow all that, here’s the easy solution to your code (I’m assuming this is in clickingmost, if not then say so):

case 7779: c.addSkillXP(c.playerXP[10]*c.playerLevel[10], 10); break;[/quote]
Was closed for a reason:/

Your code is the 3rd one I’ve tired…
They all get no errors while complieing(3rd one without error is urs)
ive tired in both potions and clickingmost but doesnt even give the xp…

Read full topic
item.source: CLOSE:Problem not fixed but noone can help

item.title: CLOSE:Problem not fixed but noone can help
item.dc:creator: @Oh-Noes Oh-Noes
item.description:
@Oh-Noes wrote:

Okay the method for addSkillXP is:

public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill)

So, the first number in the brackets is how much exp you want to add. The second is the skill ID you want it to be added to - for example attack is 0, defence is 1, hp is 3, agility is 16 and so on. So 650000 would NOT fit there.

As for your error, that’s easy - exp isn’t an existing variable, so you can’t use it. I’d assume from your code that what you’re trying to use is:

playerXP[10]

Incase you didn’t follow all that, here’s the easy solution to your code (I’m assuming this is in clickingmost, if not then say so):

case 7779: c.addSkillXP(c.playerXP[10]*c.playerLevel[10], 10); break;

Read full topic
